ygData.subject: RANT!
ygData.msgSnippet: Last night just totally sucked! I killed the loner Dervs at bothe the East and West camps in South Ro. Both were blue, non spellchuckers, and I took around a
ygData.messageBody:
Last night just totally sucked!
I killed the loner Dervs at bothe the East and West
camps in South Ro. Both were blue, non spellchuckers,
and I took around a bubble of damage from each.
I finish healing after killing the one at the West camp
and a spellchucking madman that /cons BLUE to me
proceeds to kill me because his spells going off cause
so much lag it prevents me from getting close enough to
actually hit it with my axe! 1 spell every 1.5 seconds!
Do PC spells go off that fast? Hell no! I lost more xp
that I gained from the dervs.
No big deal, I know I can make that up pretty quick.
I run to my body, not near an Orc camp and start getting
nailed by one from the 1st camp near the entrance (he
caught up to me half way there). I use the corpse
command hotkeyed to drag my body back to the entrance.
By the time I get there, I have 5 Orc Warriors and 2
casters on my ass. Normally all monsters attacking you
stop and turn around when you enter the tunnel that
marks the entrance to the Innothule zone. When I
realize they didn't, I make the zone with 15 HPs!
This set the stage for the rest of the night.
That last patch that they made got rid of a few "null"
zones (like the one I normally use as noted above) and I
think it also increased the Aggro range on creatures. I
had not faught a Spellchucking Madman solo before the
one that killed me, so I am not sure if they were beefed
up or not. My wife also noticed a new creature last
night: "a shadowed man" in West Commonlands. Someone
from her guild told her that it was around a 26th level
mobs, and it has a pet. She saw 3 of these with 1 pet
each in the South West corner just hanging out. I think
they spawn there. This means Verant is trying to
prevent the "safe paths" used by low levels to avoid the
dangers of the zone. Ie griffs and giants and kodiaks,
etc.
This could also mean that creatures previously only seen
in the Plane of Fear are now being put in the regular
zones. Look out Befallen, Mistmore and Unrest! This
may fit better than the zone path theory. These may be
another spawn creature from outside the Befallen
entrance to try to prevent PC from camping outside to
heal.

I lagged so bad last night it took me an hour to get
from Oasis to Neriak to invite someone into the guild!
By the time I got there they had logged off.

If Verant or Cerfnet or who ever just made an upgrade to
the hardware, why is there so much lag? It seems to be
getting worse, not better with each "upgrade". I am not
a hardware tech, but can someone tell me why? I used
the UOTracer program that pings every server your
connection uses to connect to EQ, and all are ok until I
get to the EQ servers.
Even people I know with cable modems were lagging last
night.

Ok, that is enough for now, but more will be coming. :)

--
Cronik <Brethren of ill Omen>
Left Hand of Thule the Pain Bringer
14th Season Troll SK
Bertoxxulous

"Greenbloods jus be Froglok trick. Smash'm and dey
blood same color a Froglok. Me smash'm Greenblood
for Thule. Thule make Cronik big feared. Make
smash'm fun."
